intro: Pimpinella saxifraga var. dissecta, commonly known as the dissected cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate, lacey appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. It thrives in rocky or calcareous soils and is often found in open woodland or along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a subject of interest in ecological studies.
